Celebrate the great outdoors this summer

Join us in celebrating all of the wonders of the natural world through learning and exploration this summer. 

Green Career Videos

 

More Green Careers Videos

Educational Resources

Green Careers

Green Careers

Discover some of the many STEM-focused green careers dealing with the environment and climate change.

Living In A Warming World

Living In A Warming World

A pdf eBook focusing on Canadian animals and how they adapt to different conditions, introducing the impacts of climate change.

Earth Month: Climate Change

Earth Month: Climate Change

Discover the probable causes, likely effects, and potential ways to mitigate climate change.

Green Energy

Green Energy

An overview of environmentally-friendly ways to generate electricity and power

 

Explore More Earth and Climate Resources

Earth-Related Events and Experiences

Summer Daily Discovery Series

Summer Daily Discovery Series

 

Earth and Climate Projects

Clothing4Climate Educator Guide

Clothing4Climate is a free project-based learning experience for your students to study the impacts of the clothing industry on climate change and how they can take action to enable change.

Learn More about Clothing4Climate Educator Guide

Tomatosphere

Tomatosphere is a hands-on program that builds scientific inquiry and experimentation skills. Investigate the effects of outer space on seed germination with your students.

Learn More about Tomatosphere

Travel4Climate

Travel4Climate gets students working together and exploring innovative solutions and emerging technologies to improve their communities. Its a project about challenging the narrative of what transportation means and proposing a new path forward.

Learn More about Travel4Climate

 

 

What motivates teens to climate action?

Instead of assuming how to motivate teens in climate action, we asked them. More than 900 told us what they want  heres their insights.

Climate Action Lab powered by Lets Talk Science is a youth-led research initiative to uncover barriers that prevent youth from taking climate action and daylight opportunity areas for climate action programming that is relevant to them.

Read their findings

Digital Literacy Education Resources and Events

Discover free digital literacy classroom resources, thought pieces, videos and more for educators, parents and students to go beyond basics and become innovators in the digital age.

Digital Literacy Teaching Resources

Robotics and Technological Thinking for Educators and Students

Robotics and Technological Thinking for Educators and Students

Learn the fundamentals of technological thinking and robotic literacy and how it can be applied in elementary and high school.

Computational Thinking

Computational Thinking

This backgrounder looks in depth at Computational Thinking (CT) and why it is important for today's students.

Cybersecurity Career Exploration

Cybersecurity Career Exploration

Students will explore different possible working environments related to the field of cybersecurity.

Data Privacy and You

Data Privacy and You

Students will learn about data privacy and how to keep their personal data safe online.

What is Blockchain and Why Does it Matter?

What is Blockchain and Why Does it Matter?

Learn about blockchain and how it is used to keep data safe.

Digital Citizenship & Ethics

Digital Citizenship & Ethics

Digital citizenship is about thinking critically, behaving safely, and participating responsibly and ethically in the digital world.
